intro: Dichaea undulifolia, commonly known as the undulating moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, creeping growth habit and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant features dark green, lance-shaped leaves that are often curled or undulating, giving it its common name. It typically grows in forest floors or on rocky substrates in temperate regions. Dichaea undulifolia plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
